original: dri autpa la sngon po sar pa lta bu rtag tu 'byung ba dang / 'tshe ba med cing 'gram ba ring ba dang / mnyen zhing gong bu ma yin pa'i dbugs dang / gsung gi dbyangs zas gcod pa dang / dman pa za ba dang /

translated: His breath is gentle and not in gasps, and his voice is like the sound of a conch.

original: dus yongs su 'gyur ba dang bral zhing mngon par gsal ba'i chos 'chad pa dang / shin tu 'khums pa dang rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang / dpe byad yul na gnas shing yongs su gsal zhing rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: dus yongs su 'gyur ba dang bral zhing mngon par gsal ba'i chos 'chad pa dang / shin tu 'khums pa dang rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang / dpe byad yul na gnas shing yongs su gsal zhing rdzogs pa dang /
translated: His speech is clear and he never changes his voice.üîΩHe is not too thin or too fat.üîΩHe is well proportioned, with the major marks of a great being clearly visible and complete.üîΩHis eyes are free of defects, because he is completely pure.üîΩHis neck is neither too long nor too short and is adorned with three folds.

original: shin tu yongs su dang ba'i phyir mthong ba rab rib med pa dang / mgrin pa ha cang ring ba dang ha cang thung ba ma yin zhing gnyer ma gsum gyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / ko sko tshad mnyam zhing brtan la yo ba med cing mi ring la rgya che ba dang /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su dang ba'i phyir mthong ba rab rib med pa dang / mgrin pa ha cang ring ba dang ha cang thung ba ma yin zhing gnyer ma gsum gyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / ko sko tshad mnyam zhing brtan la yo ba med cing mi ring la rgya che ba dang /
translated: His chin is well proportioned, firm, unmoving, not too long and broad.

original: mchu bim pa ltar dmar zhing 'jam la mdzes pa dang / rnyil gyi sha ban du dzi ba ka'i me tog ltar 'jam pa dang / tshems gtsang zhing mnyen la dag cing mdzes pa dang / mche ba mnyam zhing mtshams 'byor la zlum zhing rno la mnyen pa dang /
analyzed: mchu bim pa ltar dmar zhing 'jam la mdzes pa dang / rnyil gyi sha ban du dzi ba ka'i me tog ltar 'jam pa dang / tshems gtsang zhing mnyen la dag cing mdzes pa dang / mche ba mnyam zhing mtshams 'byor la zlum zhing rno la mnyen pa dang /
translated: His lips are as red, soft, and beautiful as bimba fruit. The flesh of his cheeks is as soft as the ban du ji ba ka flower. His teeth are clean, soft, pure, and beautiful. His fangs are even, well-proportioned, round, sharp, and soft.

original: dgos pa dang bcas na tshems las g-yas phyogs su 'od zer skad cig gis spro ba dang / ljags dri ma med cing 'jam la dmar zhing mnyen pa dang / spyi gtsug glang po che'i spyi bo'i gtsug ltar rno zhing 'jam pa dang / shangs 'jam zhing mtho ba dang /
analyzed: dgos pa dang bcas na tshems las g-yas phyogs su 'od zer skad cig gis spro ba dang / ljags dri ma med cing 'jam la dmar zhing mnyen pa dang / spyi gtsug glang po che'i spyi bo'i gtsug ltar rno zhing 'jam pa dang / shangs 'jam zhing mtho ba dang /
translated: If he has a purpose, he can emit light rays from his teeth in an instant. His tongue is spotless, soft, red, and supple. The top of his head is as sharp and soft as the top of an elephant‚Äôs head. His nose is soft and high.

original: kha spu mi mthug cing 'jam la rtsa ba brtan cing mnyen la phra ba kon da li ka sngon po lta bu dang / mkhur tshos ha cang mtho ba dang rno ba ma yin la sha rgyas shing gang ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i kha dog can dang /
analyzed: kha spu mi mthug cing 'jam la rtsa ba brtan cing mnyen la phra ba kon da li ka sngon po lta bu dang / mkhur tshos ha cang mtho ba dang rno ba ma yin la sha rgyas shing gang ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i kha dog can dang /
translated: His beard is not thick, but soft, with firm, tender, fine hairs like blue konadali flowers.üîΩHis cheeks are not too high or sharp, but full and fleshy, with an even color.üîΩHis forehead is broad and flat, like a conch or a coiled moon.

original: dpral ba'i mtshams lags par dbyes shing dung dang zla ba 'khyil ba lta bu dang / spyan yangs shing mnyen la 'jam zhing yongs su dag pa dang / rab tu dang zhing ma 'khums pa'i rdzi ma dang / mthong la dul zhing dag la mi yo bas khyab pa dang /
analyzed: dpral ba'i mtshams lags par dbyes shing dung dang zla ba 'khyil ba lta bu dang / spyan yangs shing mnyen la 'jam zhing yongs su dag pa dang / rab tu dang zhing ma 'khums pa'i rdzi ma dang / mthong la dul zhing dag la mi yo bas khyab pa dang /

original: shin tu chud ba ma yin pa'i stobs lnga pa'i phyir spyan me 'dzums pa dang / smin ma ring ba dang / gnag pa dang / 'jam pa dang / rjes su 'cham pa dang / mnyen pa'i dpral ba gser gyi byang bu dang zla ba ltar 'jam zhing yangs pa dang /

translated: The eyes are not too wide because of the power of the fifth perfection, which is concentration.üîΩThe eyebrows are long, black, soft, and well-shaped. The forehead is smooth, like a golden plate or the moon.

translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have round nails because they are free from immorality.üîΩThe Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have plump nails because they have accumulated vast and extensive roots of virtue.

translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have tapering nails because they have gradually accumulated roots of virtue.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lus dang ngag dang yid dang 'tsho ba yongs su bsrungs pa'i phyir rtsa mi mngon pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have inconspicuous veins because they have guarded their bodies, speech, minds, and livelihoods.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i mdud pa las grol ba'i phyir rtsa la mdud pa med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i mdud pa las grol ba'i phyir rtsa la mdud pa med pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have unknotted veins because they are free from the knots of the afflictions.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos rnams la thugs shin tu mi mngon pa'i phyir long bu mi mngon pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have ankles that do not protrude, because they have hidden the Dharma from those who are not disciples.

translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have feet that are even, because they deliver all beings from all difficult situations.üîΩThe Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have feet that are like the king of elephants, because they are the lions of men.

original: / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i glang po yin pa'i phyir glang po'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //üîΩsangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nam mkha' la gshegs pa'i phyir dang pa'i rgyal po'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i glang po yin pa'i phyir glang po'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nam mkha' la gshegs pa'i phyir dang pa'i rgyal po'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have feet that are like the king of bulls, because they are the bulls of men.üîΩThe Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have feet that are like the king of swans, because they move through the sky.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skor phyogs kyi lam dang mthun par gshegs pa'i phyir khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skor phyogs kyi lam dang mthun par gshegs pa'i phyir khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have feet that are like the king of geese, because they move in the direction they face.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mdzes pa'i phyir mdzes par gshegs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mdzes pa'i phyir mdzes par gshegs pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a beautiful gait because they are beautiful.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs rtag tu mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo @124b bar gshegs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs rtag tu mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo @124b bar gshegs pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have an unfaltering gait because their minds are always unwavering.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul dang yon tan yongs su dag pa ston pa'i phyir sku 'khril bag dang bcas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul dang yon tan yongs su dag pa ston pa'i phyir sku 'khril bag dang bcas pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a gait with hips well-rounded because they teach the rules and virtues that are completely pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam par dag pa'i phyir sku byi dor byas pa lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam par dag pa'i phyir sku byi dor byas pa lta bu dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a gait like a well-polished body because they are completely pure of sinful and nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos go rims bzhin du 'chad pa'i phyir sku rim par 'tsham pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos go rims bzhin du 'chad pa'i phyir sku rim par 'tsham pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a gait with limbs well-proportioned because they teach the Dharma in sequence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku gsung thugs yongs su dag pa'i phyir sku gtsang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku gsung thugs yongs su dag pa'i phyir sku gtsang ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a pure body because their body, speech, and mind are completely pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs rang bzhin gyis 'jam pa'i phyir sku 'jam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs rang bzhin gyis 'jam pa'i phyir sku 'jam pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a smooth body, because their mind is naturally gentle.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir sku rnam par dag pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir sku rnam par dag pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a pure body, because their nature is pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dpe byad yongs su rdzogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dpe byad yongs su rdzogs pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a body with the major marks complete, because their teaching of the Dharma is complete.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mdzes shing rgya che ba'i yon tan ston pa'i phyir sku kho lag yangs shing bzang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mdzes shing rgya che ba'i yon tan ston pa'i phyir sku kho lag yangs shing bzang ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a body with a good figure and proportions, because they show the qualities of beauty and greatness.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can thams cad la thugs mnyam pa'i phyir mnyam par gshegs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can thams cad la thugs mnyam pa'i phyir mnyam par gshegs pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a body with a good gait, because their mind is impartial towards all beings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa rnam pa dag pa'i phyir spyan rnam par dag pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa rnam pa dag pa'i phyir spyan rnam par dag pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have pure eyes, because their vision is pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rab tu 'jam pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir sku 'jam zhing gzhon sha can dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rab tu 'jam pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir sku 'jam zhing gzhon sha can dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a smooth body, because they teach the Dharma in a very smooth way.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu thugs ma zhum pa'i phyir sku zhum pa med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu thugs ma zhum pa'i phyir sku zhum pa med pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a body without flaccidity, because their mind is always without flaccidity.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mthon po dang ldan pa'i phyir sku rgyas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mthon po dang ldan pa'i phyir sku rgyas pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a full body, because they have the highest roots of good.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yang srid pa'i tshogs yongs su zad pa'i phyir sku shin tu grims pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yang srid pa'i tshogs yongs su zad pa'i phyir sku shin tu grims pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a body without defects, because they have exhausted the possibility of rebirth.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag dang nying lag legs par 'chad pa'i phyir yan lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag dang nying lag legs par 'chad pa'i phyir yan lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have limbs and joints that are very well-defined, because they explain well the major and minor parts of dependent origination.

translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have pure vision, because their seeing is very pure.

original: ldan 'das rnams ni tshul phun sum tshogs pa'i slob ma mnga' ba'i phyir dku zlum pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ldan 'das rnams ni tshul phun sum tshogs pa'i slob ma mnga' ba'i phyir dku zlum pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have rounded bellies, because they have disciples who are well-rounded in morality.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'khor ba'i skyon rnam par dag pa'i phyir dku'i skabs phyin pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'khor ba'i skyon rnam par dag pa'i phyir dku'i skabs phyin pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have bellies without defects, because they are free from the defects of cyclic existence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nga rgyal gyi de'u bcom pa'i phyir dku ma rnyongs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nga rgyal gyi de'u bcom pa'i phyir dku ma rnyongs pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have bellies without protruding veins, because they have destroyed the protruding veins of pride.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos rnams zad par mi byed pa'i phyir phyal byang de ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have bellies without protruding bones, because they do not cause the exhaustion of the Dharma.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu zab pa'i chos rtogs shing khong du chud pa'i phyir lte ba zab pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have deep navels, because they have realized and penetrated the very profound Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rjes su mthun zhing gzung bar 'os pa'i slob ma mnga' ba'i phyir lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rjes su mthun zhing gzung bar 'os pa'i slob ma mnga' ba'i phyir lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa dag yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have clockwise body hairs because they have suitable and worthy disciples.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kun nas mdzes pa'i slob ma'i tshogs mnga' ba'i phyir kun nas mdzes pa dag yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs shin tu gtsang ba'i phyir kun du spyod pa gtsang ba dag yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have pure conduct because they have a very pure mind.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba gnag bag med pa ston pa'i phyir sku la sme ba dang gnag bag med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba gnag bag med pa ston pa'i phyir sku la sme ba dang gnag bag med pa dag yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have bodies free from moles and blemishes because they teach the Dharma-Vinaya free from obscurity.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku shing bal ltar yang ba'i chos ston pa brnyes pa'i phyir phyag shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku shing bal ltar yang ba'i chos ston pa brnyes pa'i phyir phyag shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa dag yin no //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang gi gnyen gyi tshogs spangs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang gi gnyen gyi tshogs spangs te /

analyzed: dge sbyong chen po'i dngos po brnyes pa'i phyir phyag gi ri mo mdangs yod pa dag yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bslab pa'i gnas ha cang spangs par mi 'cha' ba'i phyir phyag gi ri mo zab pa dag yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ma nyen pa sngon du 'gro bas 'dul ba'i phyir ljags mnyen pa dag yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have soft tongues, because they tame by first being gentle.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yon tan phra mo ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ljags srab pa dag yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byis pa'i skye bo chags pa can rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ljags dmar ba dag yin no //

translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a pleasant, soft, and gentle voice because they have disciples who are pleasant, soft, and gentle.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni srid pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnam par log pa'i phyir mche ba zlum pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have round teeth because they have turned away from the fetters of existence.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skye bo rnon po 'dul ba la mkhas pa'i phyir mche ba rno ba dag yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba shin tu dkar ba'i phyir mche ba dkar ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have white teeth because their Doctrine and Discipline are very pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mnyam pa'i sa'i cha la zhugs pa'i phyir mche ba mnyam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mnyam pa'i sa'i cha la zhugs pa'i phyir mche ba mnyam pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have even teeth because they have entered the stage of evenness.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rim gyis ston pa'i phyir mche ba byin gyis phra ba dag yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes rab mthon bo'i sar zhugs pa'i phyir shangs mtho ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have prominent noses because they have entered the stage of exalted wisdom.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gdul bya gtsang sme'i skye bo dang ldan pa'i phyir shangs gtsang ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have clean noses because they are endowed with a pure community of disciples.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir spyan yangs pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have large eyes because they are endowed with the vast qualities of a Buddha.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku thams cad kun du stug pa'i phyir rdzi ma stug pa yin no //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mig dkar nag 'byes shing padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu'i lha dang ma yin dang / mi gzhon nu rnams kyis mchog tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir spyan dkar nag 'byes shing padma'i 'dab ma lta bu dag yin no //

translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have eyes that are like pure blue lotuses because they are very pleasing to the young gods, men, and demigods.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mdun phyogs su gzigs pa'i phyir smin tshugs ring ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have long eyes because they always look in front of them.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam par 'dul ba la mkhas pa'i phyir rdzi ma 'jam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam par 'dul ba la mkhas pa'i phyir rdzi ma 'jam pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have soft eyelashes because they are skilled in gentle discipline.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skyon kun du mkhyen pa'i phyir smin ma'i spu mnyam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skyon kun du mkhyen pa'i phyir smin ma'i spu mnyam pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have even eyebrows because they know all faults.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jam zhing mnyen pas skye bo'i rgyud 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir smin ma snum pa dag yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos mchog tu don dang ldan pa mnga' ba'i phyir @126a * //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have eyebrows that are smooth and soft, because they tame the mind-streams of beings with gentle and soft roots of virtue.

analyzed: snyan shal sdug cing snyan shal ring ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have ears that are beautiful and long, because they possess the supreme Dharma that is meaningful.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir snyan mnyam pa dag yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gdul bya rgyud ma nyams pa mnga' ba'i phyir snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa dag yin no ;
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have unimpaired faculties of hearing, because they possess unimpaired mind-streams of disciples.

analyzed: / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lta bar song ba thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dpral ba legs par 'byes pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have foreheads that are well-formed, because they have abandoned all views.

translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a broad forehead, for they conquer the ascetics and brahmins and all adversaries.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dbu shin tu rgyas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dbu shin tu rgyas pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a very full head, for they have fulfilled their prayers.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yul gyi skye bo la rnam par chags pa log pa'i phyir dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa dag yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos dkar pos ma skyes pa'i bstan pa'i ro dang ldan pa'i phyir dbu skra 'jam pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have soft hair, for they have the taste of the teaching which is not born from the white and black.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu tshig rtsub spangs pa'i phyir dbu skra mi bshor ba dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have hair of the head that is not disarrayed, because they have always abandoned harsh speech.
